result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett W Marchetti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Probation may be transferred to Kenosha County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No violent contact with A.M.G.  Attend Anger Management Counseling.  Attend Domestic Violence Counseling at Agent's discretion.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Brett W Marchetti in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS JAIL;

TERM OF PROBATION:  6 MONTHS, (probation may be transferred to Kenosha County)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  

*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No violent contact with:  A.M.G.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Attend Anger Management Counseling.
*Attend Domestic Violence Counseling (at agent's discretion).
*Perform 20 Hours Community Service. 
COURT COSTS:  $343.00 (includes domestic abuse surcharge) - (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read into count #2.  Bail remains as set.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brett W Marchetti in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests the Court set the matter for trial.  The victim is in Court and requests the Court modify the bail to no violent contact with the victim.  The State takes no position.  The Court amends the bond accordingly.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Weathers advises the Court the Defendant recently had surgery.    The Court adjourns the plea and sentencing and reschedules the matter in about 45 days.
